title_or_summary: On 2025-03-26, the Employment Insurance Board of Appeal Regulations were published, coming into force with section 634 of the Budget Implementation Act, 2023, No. 1.

title_or_summary: On 2025-03-26, an Order amended the Domestic Substances List under CEPA 1999, applying significant new activity provisions to phenol, dimethyl-, phosphate (3:1) to assess risks.
description_or_details: The Chemicals Management Plan (CMP) is a Government of Canada initiative to assess and manage risks from substances to people and the environment. This Order, issued under subsection 87(3) of CEPA, applies significant new activity (SNAc) provisions to phenol, dimethyl-, phosphate (3:1) (trixylyl phosphate). SNAc provisions allow the Minister to request information to assess potential environmental and human health risks when a substance is used in a new way or quantity. If risks are identified, risk management measures may be recommended. The CMP, launched in 2006, involves assessments by Environment and Health departments to identify and manage hazardous properties and uses of substances.

llm_processing_result.timeline_summary: On 2025-03-26, an Order amended the Domestic Substances List under CEPA 1999, applying significant new activity provisions to phenol, dimethyl-, phosphate (3:1) to assess risks.

SNAc provisions allow the Minister to request information to assess potential environmental and human health risks when a substance is used in a new way or quantity. If risks are identified, risk management measures may be recommended. The CMP, launched in 2006, involves assessments by Environment and Health departments to identify and manage hazardous properties and uses of substances.
